format: A data frame with 10387 observations on the following 16 variables.
description:
Description
A data set on attitudes about the justifiability of abortion in the United States
based on World Values Survey responses recorded across six waves (from 1982
to 2011). I assembled this data frame probably around 2014 and routinely use it
for in-class illustration about regression, post-estimation simulation, quantities of
interest, and how to think about modeling a dependent variable that is on a
1-10 scale, but has curious heaping patterns.
title: Attitudes on the Justifiability of Abortion in the United States (World Values Survey, 1982-2011)
reference:
Data come from the World Values Survey. Note that the college education variable
is curiously NA until the third survey wave. The child autonomy index ranges from
-2 to 2 where increasing values indicate that children should learn determination and
independence over obedience and religious faith. The respectauthority variable is coded
where -1  means the respondent believes greater respect for authority in the United States
as a future change to the country would be a bad thing. 0 means the respondent doesn't mind
such a change. 1 = the respondent believes it would be a good thing.

parameters.ideology: the ideological self-placement of the respondent on a 1-10 scale (1 = furthest to the left; 10 = furthest to the right)
parameters.female: a dummy variable that equals 1 if the respondent is a woman
parameters.satisfinancial: the respondent's financial satisfaction with his/her life (1 = most dissatisfied; 10 = most satisfied)
parameters.respectauthority: would more respect for authority be a welcome change to the United States?
parameters.wvsccode: the country code for the United States (a numeric constant)
parameters.nationalpride: a dummy that equals 1 if the respondent is very proud to be an American.
parameters.trustmostpeople: can most people be trusted (1) or "(you) never can be too careful" (0)
parameters.postma4: the post-materialist index for the respondent (-1 = materialist; 0 = mixed, 1 = post-materialist)
parameters.collegeed: a dummy variable that equals 1 if the respondent graduated from college
parameters.cai: the child autonomy index, which ranges from -2 to 2
parameters.age: the age of the respondent in years
parameters.aj: the justifiability of abortion on a 1-10 scale (1 = never justifiable; 10 = always justifiable)
parameters.year: the survey year corresponding to the survey wave
parameters.unemployed: a dummy variable that equals 1 if the respondent is unemployed
parameters.godimportant: the importance of God to the respondent on a 1-10 scale (1 = God is not at all important; 10 = God is most important)
